message:
I can not even imagine some of the things the fire department has seen in that tower. I am sure it will haunt them for years. 
Our firefighters are true hero's.
I'm sorry but to me showing all these photos is very disrespectful to all those people that have lost loved ones & their homes... Do they honestly wish to see these photos.. Err i think not 😢

100% agree. Thought exactly the same! The families and survivers need answers and a plan in place to stop this from happening again. Clearly all buildings and high rise flats like these need money invested in them ... councils are also the problem.... just because a person is on benefits or a on a small wage doesnt mean u deserve any less than of a householder . The same inspections of properties goes for all! I feel for every person involved homeowners and emergency services ... not enough is done to protect us low income people and vunerable people from having the life we deserve. Rant over!
Is it not part of a public inquiry though?

Andrew Ganley Thanks.. It honestly doesn't matter how much money these people earn high/low whether they have savings etc or not. It's the fact that all this could of been prevented that makes it so heartbreaking. Of course they want  answers but unfortunately it's gonna take time because of the severity of it. What angers me is the media posting all these horrifc photos of inside the building when not everyone knows if their loved ones have been killed!
Charly Markham did I say it was? I'm merely stating it's far too early to be posting these horrifc photos
No you didn't.  That's why I'm asking the question.
I agree with you. X
Totally agree with you Julie, showing these photos will be the last thing the people who have lost loved ones will want to see 😢
I thought the same....
Charly Markham as far as I'm aware there will be a public enquiry
Thank you Sarah Burrell Ann-Marie Coyle & Tracey Brocking xx

I thort the same however they will be made public anyway, And it does state that these pictures are of the flats that the people living inside are safe and have been told about them. I don't think they are any worse than other photos that have been released, should still have a warning on them so people can choose to look at them......its truly horrific what has happened here and I can't imagine what the families are going through they shouldn't just fall upon them.

It does say if you read the article that the persons whose flat it was has given their permission for them to be used. 
Heartbreaking that they have absolutely nothing left
To early to b posting pics like these considering they are still searching for missing victims
Hayley Reid These photos are more horrifc than any others that have been posted
Sophie Lee Oh so because the got permission of the resident from that flat its okay to post.. Not all other residents would want to see them would they?
The authority are doomed in whatever they do!!!!....  For all those affected??... How to find a body in this everything is charred!
Cathy Che  Doomed?? Are you Serious?? It's called showing respect something the media obviously have no clue on
I saw the film on BBC news so everyone will see it.
I totally agree
Karen Welch film? I missed that..  Yes everyone will see these images now. With no thought of those whom have no clue on missing loved ones.. heartless 😢
Having dyspraxia I know what I'm thinking but I can't write it down. The BBC showed the pictures that what I meant.
The photos were released after a meeting with many of the residents so the public can understand what the fire service and police are up against when trying to recover the bodies.
Karen Welch  ah I see..think it's the weather hun it's making everyone make mistakes 😉 x
Clare Glenister was that with all the residents??

I believe most of them yes, there was a big meeting where they sorted out finances and helping to rehouse them.  Obviously some are still in hospital but each family had a representative.  It's a very, very sad situation for everyone involved.  It must be hard that everyone is protesting too because it means nothing can get done properly as they are trying to sort that.  I think the residents want calm so they can get the help they need properly.  Hard for all involved. Xz

Clare Glenister I'm not saying they didn't but finding it hard to believe that all those residents would of agreed to these photos being shown.. It's just too soon. I mean if they want calm then they are going the wrong way about it as things like this stirs things up again xx 😢
Julie Golding best for the families to be resolved privatly
It's been done because they wanted calm - and it's worked as things have calmed down.  I guess they need to go about it the way they feel best as they are the ones in that situation, not us.

I' understand what ur saying Julie Golding 
But when uve  been up there and seen the devastation from the fire u understand what these poor people are going through,believe me it's not a pretty sight there,hopefully these pictures will be a wake up call to the government to do more to help.
The police released the photos.

I think they've been made public to try and show the scale of the recovery operation. People are angry about the numbers of missing and think that the true number is being purposely withheld. It's a way of saying that they aren't going to be able to find bodies that can be easily identified, without actually saying out loud that those missing are probably, sadly cremated to ashes. I think they've been released so that people can come to that realisation themselves and somewhat understand the magnitude of it all. It's so very very sad and tragic, I just can't comprehend how those affected will ever move on from this, from having their whole lives and loved ones, so needlessly and so tragically, taken from them.
They asked the families if it was ok....it was on the news yesterday....
Read the article before commenting the families that owned the apartments are alive and said it was okay for the police to release the photos/videos

Diana Hackney Thank you.. So the police are trying to say to people this is why it's taking so long to recover bodies as not everyone like you & I understand what the job entails. It's heartbreaking that to have to go to these lengths to prove this
I don't even live in London and these photos are so heartbreaking. 😢
Machaela Mitchell  Err i did read the article which is why I did comment & I am totally aware the families that owned the apartments gave their permission to release the photos..
Abi Jeffery Hounslow I totally agree with you
I do,to see the full extent of what happened,just because you don't.
Allan Sim if you wish to see them then that's your choice
So what's your problem then it's not up to you whether they should release videos or pictures of their house/apartment
Exactly,it's not up to you whether they should or shouldn't

People seriously need to actually read the article before spreading negative opinions
These people are alive and well and consented to show the photos they wanted others to see what they lost due to negligence on the council's part 
it's good awareness to the public
Have you see the state of that building???!!!....  Would you just get in it hours after the inferno to start counting dead people???.....

besides anyone who has died should be all our business and concerns
Their respect they should be shown is for the council to shape up and not let it ever happen again and give the survivours good homes back and chance to move on when they are ready not stuck in a building with many others living like they are still in danger at any second 
ptsd is horrible injury and it should be reduced as much as possible  for all loved ones and survivors and we should all care about every single life that had suffered or has been lost we should morn with their loved ones and show they aren't alone with their loss we are all outraged too at what led up to the preventable incident and it should never have happened 
but that isn't as worse as the missing loved ones that may never be discovered because of the extent of the fire  :-( to think if that person I loved and knew well I can't imagine how the loved ones are going through beyond words :-(

Honestly, there is another thread running that I commented on  stating it's a Tory cover up, they should be out by now, they are hiding the true number, etc.... And that's why the photos have been released, to make people understand.  People still won't, they are still arguing about a conspiracy and cover up on the other thread.  Sometimes these devastating and tragic accidents happen - but it won't happen to anyone else and now millions of peoples lives will get better because they will get the upgrades they so badly need.  I am not saying what happened is a good thing so please don't misunderstand me, but this has shocked everyone and they'll now do the upgrades which so many h MP's voted down in the past (and one of these no voters was Corbyn in 2005 before it turns into a party slanging match - there are so many fingers we can be pointing but now is not the right time as it changes nothing today).  My nan lived in a tower block like this at the top, fires happen but they should be contained.  It's just too shocking to comprehend that so many have lost their lives like this. :'(
The stuff they used in this flat as been BANNED thank god so hoping they look in to other flats that may have it sort them out try void this again
Machaela Mitchell Err did I say it was??
Lorraine Bertram Err u think you need to read through all my comments
Clare Glenister it's completely shocking what happened
It's all about awareness... the word needs to get out, something went terribly wrong for it to be this bad. My heart breaks for everyone involved with this terrible tragedy :(
Jessica Busby it's just a heartbreaking way of having to make people aware.

I have and I also read all your comments all in this article and you keep still sticking with the naive thought that the family didn't consent to these photos shared bla bla bla and you still haven't read the article

Lorraine Bertram Let me correct you I'm fully aware that the family gave permission for these photos to be posted.. I am also aware that the police have also asked & the reasons behind it... Just merely stated that not all families of those missing would wish this to happen.. Simple as that. Now toddle take all into account before you decide to make any further accusations!!
Machaela Mitchell what's so funny??
Machaela your getting told you😂
James Hay And you think that you won't 😂
James Hay😂
Julie Golding fa you speaking to?

This should never of happened, this is the price you pay for cutting corners, to be precise £5000 difference in the cladding that wouldn't ignite! So for the sake of £5000, a huge number of people have died, totally dispicable!! Someone needs to take responsibility for what they have done, 
2017 - absolute disgrace
Sleek Khunt was on the board that agreed to the cuts
What's more of an insult is the 5 n half grand the government have given the family's, that won't even cover a funeral?

Cheap crap and massive corners must have been cut . The part that wasn't destroyed is prob the only part done right . That where the scaffolding would have been left up for the council to check to work .

There council were told it would cost 30m to do the work , with proper not cheap knock off's. can u tell me how polystyrene cladding can be fireproof.
Polyurethane mate it's suppose to have a rating of 1 hour before it burns it must have been a lacker in the paint on the cladding

They've said what they used is banned in the U.K.  
They'd better remove it from that school next door and any other buildings where it's been used. Unbelievable. 😡😡

Poor people 😔 going through there last minutes in there own house with there own family.. there last wish and hoping to still come out and survive it's so sad 😥 no one knows what happens tomorrow now days... may there souls rest in peace ❤️
Someone or a few people will go to Jail for this.

I can't get my head around what had happend here. I hope to god someone gets charged with manslaughter. All them poor innocent lives lost. The terror and fear they must of been going through in there last moments. It's unbearable to think about. It should never of happened. And the fire fighters what they have to deal with it's going to scar them for life.
Their only showing it so people see the task they have ahead obviously its not going to be a quick recovery of sadly all the victims who lost their lifes
There's honestly no need to show these images at this present time
The residents asked they be shown because of the protesters making things difficult for the recovery workers.  They explained this in the news.
Yes there is julie,it's been explained to you many times,if you don't like it then look at something else....

I'm sorry, but these picture should not be made public. What if a survivor somehow recognises that it was their flat? What good does this do? Yes to filming for investigative reasons - but I sure as hell don't want to see images of some poor persons home reduced to ash, we can all try and imagine and that should be enough. RIP to all victims and RESPECT to all survivors 💜
The person whose flat it was gave permission, as did other residents, to help people understand the task that the recovery teams have.

More than one flat is featured - where does it say in this article that permission was given? I read "The images released today have been taken inside flats where police know that everyone has been accounted for. A resident of each flat has been notified by police of the release of the material".   Notified is different to giving permission isn't it?
Police speak??! I am horrified that the authorities are are giving just £5500. thats not going to go very far. I hope the council obtains housing for ALL the survivors and pays for that as well..
No quite sure how you think someone is going to recognise their flat,have you saw pics,there is nothing left of them,shells
Keeley they have been released ok,deal with it....

People seriously need to actually read the article before spreading negative opinions
These people are alive and well and consented to show the photos they wanted others to see what they lost due to negligence on the council's part
it's good awareness to the public

Where does it say they gave permission? I read the article and didn't see that. I'm entitled to my opinion as are you. As for alive and well? How do you know they are well? I didn't read that bit either.You have assumed they are well. I agree that the images should be taken for the investigation- I did actually say that in my first comment. Are you unaware of what a burnt out flat would look like? I fail to see how showing the inside of those flats brings about good awareness to the public? I saw the building burn for two days from the outside and that was awful enough.
at the bottom of the page
then you wouldn't have to ask these questions

it wasn't just taken for investigation 
clearly shows you haven't read the article at all 
no where does it state this 
it is shared to show that finding bodies is not going. to be possible to stop the rioters from preventing them from doing their jobs
it states they are Alice and well all the tenants of flats in the photos consented to its share

I didn't quote that the images were taken for investigative reasons from the article!  That was my own assumption. You have stated that at the bottom of the page- (that I have just read AGAIN) is where you got your "alive and well and gave permission" doesn't say that ANYWHERE in the article! The media has told us constantly that the recovery of bodies is on going. There's no need for images to prove this further! Where have you got the information that the images were published to stop rioters?! I haven't read that anywhere.

Lorraine Bertram no it does not. It DOES say the flats pictured are those of survivors. It Doesn't say they are WELL and doesn't say they gave PERMISSION. Perhaps you should read the article again yourself 👍

It's just so heartbreaking everything all those family's went through but also the aftermath of what these firefighters have to go through and see inside that building what's left of it obviously it's gonna take some time for the recovery of all those still inside my heart goes out to all involved x
Betty Keys £5500 isn't near enough for a life for their belongings and family and friends lost my heart goes to all the residence of the Glen fall tower heart breaking x

I myself had a house fire and lost everything so awful  to see  these photos but am diaguated that every person is gonna recieve £5,000 if i have read  correctly -that  is never gonna be enough to put oast behind nothing will bring their loved ones back but that sort of  money   ia nevwe even gonna help rhwm have a new start my fire alone was about 7 thousands  -19 years ago -and my burglary 5 yeara ago was £10,000 -some thinga will never be replaced but this measley sum wont even buy furniture clothes personal goods foe there next property  i was lucky both times i was insured but not everyone has that back up ---rip to all the people who died x
It does say 'at least' if you read it.

I hope at the minimum being 5k it will rise really high 
council n government needs to be mighty generous than 5 K min 
because they are responsible 
the cost of the fireproof would be a lot less than the cost they have to fork out after something like this n then I thought well they deserve to owe them everything they got for what they caused
I know ir says at least but it needa to be about 10 times that figure

Im no expert but im sure the interior kitchen walls shoud be made of breeze block or brick to stop fire speading to the rest of the building if this was done no matter how hot the fire the wall shoud be there Crazy
Council should be done for murder absolutely heart wrenching
I agree louise jennings council should be done for this.
manslaughter not murder
The can only be charged with manslaughter, as it was not a premeditated act.

How can it nor be predicted.  . . They took.short cuts on.peoples safety they should be hung out to dry 
 . . . . .so.so sad xx

How can they say it's not premeditated? Please correct me if I'm wrong but does it not say it the article that the cladding used is banned on high rise flats? If so then the council would of known this.
not premeditated asin planned

But they would have known the cladding shouldn't of been used so in not so many words it could be classed as premeditated as they knew what the outcome would be if a fire started. The council would have had to know the ins and outs of the cladding before being able to use it.

Murder is an act that requires the planning and taking of a life.
While it is disgusting that people knew that cladding was poorly designed and prone to combust in a short time frame when exposed to a naked flame, it is at best recklessness endangerment to human life or manslaughter.
The developers and Council took a gamble that nothing wrong would happen and unfortunately that gamble cost the lives of many.
So as disgusting as their actions are, a murder charge would not stick but a manslauter charge is possible or at least recklessness endangerment.
I know that is not what many would like but that is the justice system for you.
Manslaughter is good enough a charge for them all responsible

What if the council were given the wrong information about the spec of the cladding, they are reliant upon those supplying it, so without the council having it independantly tested themselves they wouldn't have the foggiest if it was up to spec or not, the council will have just signed off the payment for it. Hopefully the inquiry will get to the bottom of this and identify who is responsible for the corporate. Manslaughter of so many people. It's so easy to speculate and people maybe correct in their assumptions, but hopefully the police investigation and public inquiry will establish the facts.

Well done to the sun news paper again for this one, not only is it bad enough that all the victims here lost everything and some lost loved ones or friends but you go and show pictures of what was once there homes or just reminding them of what they once had !!!! You really do come up with things that so long as your selling and making money wether it is at someone's expense, sorry but wrong move again on this occasion!!!! Think the victims have seen/been through enough!!!! 😡😡😡😡

So what about the sprinkler  system that should have been installed but is rumoured to not have been installed due to majority of the residents not wanting it? Not condoning any of this has fault just seems there is a lot of truths that are being hidden

5k for the cost of everything you own and lost friends and family , it's that what they are worth 👊👊👊 that's if there's anyone left to pay any money to , I've yet to see anyone alive from the flats or receiving any of the things donated
In all fairness, there have been interviews with quite a few people who escaped, not that it should have happened in the first place, but that God some survived
I think it's an emergency fund, to help them to get by initially, I may be wrong. I don't think that's all they will be getting, I hope not anyway.
They have only given them access to 500 quid the rest will be sent out by dwp and we all no there track record x

5000 is the minimum too 
it could go up
Theresa Anne Gunner I've seen a handful at best no where near the 500 that lived in the building

The whole event was a terrible thing, it will take a long time for a lot of people to get over this. RIP those that lost their lives and hopefully the survivors can rebuild their lives. We are so lucky to have people that will risk their own lives for the sake of others...xx

This is so insensitive. Disgusted to see this is being printed, have some respect for those who have passed and those still missing... leave our community to grieve in peace and stop treating this like a circus show!!!!!
The residents asked that the information was put out so people understood the task that was at hand.  Protesters are making their recovery efforts difficult.
Oh shut up!

I'm only going to say this once more if I see another comment like this I'll post this on the main  comment section 
we don't need your negative comment spewing hatred in any direction if you want to share your anger it shouldn't be toward the police or firefighters 
they got their mission they are doing their job 
it should be toward the council who were partly responsible for this happening 
they are the ones who took these lives that may never be found and this is what the services have to deal with they are letting the public know bodies may not be found and this is the extent of why 

" People seriously need to actually read the article before spreading negative opinions
These people are alive and well and consented to show the photos they wanted others to see what they lost due to negligence on the council's part
it's good awareness to the public"

How anybody got out is amazing. At least by showing these awful images it will show people why it will take as long as it's take to recover love one . Some of the journalist questions here been so stupid.  The people task to do the recovery have to record collect evidence .
It's very likely that some of the victims will not be never be found as would of been incinerated  in that  intense heat. Meaning the families of victims  will never get the closure and a funeral.

feel sad because someone from them flats is going to recognise the exercise bike or something else and it's going to be heartbreaking all over again. We know it was bad, we know it was completely gutted and we can all imagine what it looks like we don't need the pics. find them disrespectful. These people have lost enough. Also this is a grave site for many..
If the cladding used is being banned in high rise buildings. I wondered how it got passed all the safety test? This is something u would expect in third world countries NOT London.
I can understand the concerns of family members of how this tragedy has  happened. It is easy to afford blame but let us look to the realism of how this tragedy occurred before we afford blame.
This is so upsetting knowing each and everyone this was there homes and some of them are still missing  ! It's heartbreaking . X 🤔😢
The fire brigade are storing 140 bodies on the 4th floor so the clean up people can start on the top floors but there won't two know one about this,one flat 47 people in from other flats

Wonder how many illegals were in there, it's devastating, but not sure how the current government are responsible? Considering it was a labour government that gave the go ahead to be built, a labour government that signed it off, a labour government that was told to knock it down in 1999, but didn't, you could say it's another Blair mass murder.

I'm sorry to hear about the tower n the people n family's that ave died but when I read n heard about it no 1 mentioned about any fire alarms  were their any fire alarms in the building so people could of for out quicker

Omg shocking and disrespectful specially to the family of there love one I think those pictures should be taking down as I don't care if the police showing public as I can't think they wouldn't like it if someone done this to there love ones come on dose the family really need to see this on a daily bases while they are still grieving
It states the pictures are from flats where residents have been accounted for. But I agree it is a bit too much releasing them.
The residents asked the photos be released so people understood the recovery efforts facing the fire service.
The police released the pics.
Zzzzzz.... don't like it then look at something else

fickin read the actual article 
can you not read or something
do you still read baby picture books 
clearly you still do or else 
oh guess what ?!

you'll see all the comments left before you with this same stupid naive comment being left and the answer being told to them over and over again

My heart's broken for those who perished in this terrible tragedy and their families just like everyone else who has commented on this link..it's inconceivable that this could happen..I also pray to God that they were asleep and knew nothing..but I know this wasn't the case for everyone..May they rest in peace..What I would like to know and welcome anyone's input..Why didn't we have helicopters flying above the tower building dropping in water from the top into the flat. ? I've been asking myself this question from the moment I watched the inferno..I don't understand .. if this was done the outcome would have been so different..The fire would obviously have been put out quicker..Also we're being told about how many lives have been lost so far on updates..but nothing about how many lives have been saved..unless someone has heard something I haven't..😥
Julie I agree love should not put pics on it's disrespectful they need to sort out what they are going to do to help these poor people they are upset enough without seeing this
READ the article before commenting
There will not be enough left to forensically identify most of those that perished inside. A fire burning that hot for that long will leave nothing but dust.
This goes deeper than we think. We probably will never be given the real answer as to how so many were allowed to die
I also really like to know why it took 12 hours for the fire men to come to the scene
Lorraine Bertram 12 hours ?

Yes that's what I read the very morning after the night the fire was burning at its worst 
I though that is more than shocking

perhaps it was them fighting it putting it out took 12 hours :-/ 
at the time I was in shock by it all 
ptsd doesn't let me read things properly in that state
Did I just read that right.. the cladding used is banned on high rise flats? If so how the heck did it pass all the relevant safety tests etc..

I don't know how true that is but what I do know babe is that to get the fire retardant cladding was an extra £2 per panel. To cover that whole building at that price was £5000. That's all these poor people's lives were worth. A measly 5 grand. Sickening. 😒
Again the council cutting corners and trying to save costs. 😡😡
It's ended up costing them a lot more then £5000 and all those poor families 😢
There are a lot more victims in there, but its being played down

it would take police forensics months to test all the areas for human remains. its one big systematic job floor by floor, room by room. its going to be an investigation with the fire, police and possible H&S and the local council may do their own review of it or weed off internal  files. all for a public inquest.
I bet there's at least 200 lost there lives poor people  them who r responsible want servery punishing
Absolutely devastating 😢 my heart goes out to everyone who is affected  😘❤
Hope the leader of the council party an all the planning committee are held responsible
If residents had turned all their taps on at the offset, would that have made a difference?
In a video it said that there was no water going to the top flats as the lower levels were using there taps. over loading the water system. 😢
Oh, that settles THAT then!

It was ridiculous living conditions in this building 
they also said to have no lighting or something either I cant remember exactly but it's such a disgrace at the conditions they lived in before all this too because housing didn't want to pay out more than their budget on their property 
it's all very heartbreaking
This is wrong of police releasing these pictures the images these families have imagined are confirmed by these pictures totally disrespectful feel for all the families
It states in the vid that they have the permission of the person who lived in that flat.
Laurie Summerfield still for some it will be just too graphic
Nothing disrespectful about it!
READ THE ARTICLE BEFORE COMMENTING !!!!!!!!!!!!
Poor souls didn't stand a chance R.I.P heartbreaking.

So so sad and scary poor poor people
  God give them
All
Strength xxx
Heartbreaking ,it sends shivers down my spine ,those poor people trapped in there ,
I find it hard to believe a fridge did this bloody hell even those dodgy tumble dryer didn't cause that much damage
The fridge started the fire in a normal block it would of been contained the fridge didnt cause that to go up in 15 mins the cladding did !!

well, in all my 64 years, I have never ever known a fridge to explode as this one is alleged to have done! The fuse would have gone first! There are a few conspiracy theories going around, and I have to admit to feeling disquieted with some of them!!
This country works for the rich,and sod the poor.(And I'm no Leftie..far from it!).
OMG This is heart breaking and to think people could come out alive from that,let alone die in that burnt alive.
I don't want to think about that part, I'm hoping that the smoke  got to them first.
It properly did babe as I have COPD which is a breathing this smoke will stop you breathing.But the picture says a thousand words that is why we should get justice for them.

I've suffocated to near death due to asthma n dust allergy no one was around to save me 
I lay on the floor and saw white and blue before almost passing out I willed myself to fall asleep 
luckily I was saved from that attack just in time 
if you say smoke like this will stop your breathing then they must have suffocated to death 
it's not a nice way to go :-( 😢😢😢
I know I went in to reispotory arrest once but I was in hospital thank god it was the most scary thing in my life .not not nice but I came back thanks to the doctors and nurses.
I know I went in to reispotory arrest once but I was in hospital thank god it was the most scary thing in my life .not not nice but I came back thanks to the doctors and nurses.

I'm so glad you are still with us and you were in hospital when it happens and they managed to bring you back to us 
so close 
some people feel lucky to be alive and live harder .but I can't 
I hide away and am more terrified of life and destroy 
enjoying what you got due to my traumas happening so young I know it leads to something. bad like death I can't enjoy myself the same 
I try take each day as it comes 
as 
that wasn't my only near death experience or traumatic experience 
I wouldn't give my life to anyone else to have to deal with but I would trade it in even half of it 
it's too much me to carry or any one person to carry 
everything I went through 

but the death experience that  was most terrifying one that haunts me daily makes articles like this worst for me n makes me grieve the lost lives a lot more is when I died saw them fill out my death cetificate and went into the complete darkness tunnel 
before being shoved back into my body by unseen force 
it's never left me 
again I was very young n died while asleep on operating table so it's very hard to sleep now a days at the right time I take panic attacks when I wake up 
its 1 pm n I have had one broke sleep falling asleep at 7pm waking at 9pm not being able to go back to sleep due to nightmares 
I wouldn't wish ptsd on anyone 
I pine for the souls that have lost their lives to this horrific and terrifying way of dying 
I was lucky not to suffer like they did even my drowning in the pool feeling it burning my throat and chest being sick n having throat issues ever since wouldn't come close to what they endured in their last moment 
the hardest part would be when they throw their loved ones out the window to save them but never knowing if they were caught or not or if they died that way :-( taking that gamble in desperation to save their children's lives 
and watching loved ones dying with them trapped with them that is a punishment in itself 
that is horrific to even picture their last moment 'but I can't help it 
I've witnessed my loved ones die in horrible ways 

I just wish now that 
the loved ones and survivors wont suffer ptsd n the grieve of loss as much as painfully possible and get all the support they need the way it looks is they aren't getting what they need and aren't treated very well still by the council even now after the tragedy 
I wish all this injustice pain n suffering in the world would be still and things like this be prevented never to happen like it should have been unwind the clock and reverse it all
I want to know what brand the was which caused people's death.
These condition are inhuman London you have lost points looks and acts more like a third world country
What I want to know is are they allowing the people who's flats didn't get touched aloud there belongings surely they can't refuse them
And you think that's gonna be safe to do so?
